;;以色列士兵在诺瓦节遭到来自加沙附近的哈马斯枪手袭击的现场检查一名参加节日的人被烧毁的汽车以色列南部与加沙地带的边界，2023 年 10 月 13 日。路透社/Amir Cohen ;
;

;以色列军事法医小组检查了上周哈马斯袭击以色列周边社区的受害者尸体。官员周六表示，加沙地带发现了多种酷刑、强奸和其他暴行的迹象。

;

;大约 1,300 具尸体已被运至以色列中部拉姆拉的一个军事基地，法医将在那里进行检查，以确定死者的身份。前陆军参谋长拉比以色列·韦斯 (Rabbi Israel Weiss) 拉比表示，大约 90% 的军人死者身份已得到确认，平民身份确认工作已完成一半，负责死者身份识别的官员之一。他说，许多尸体都显示出遭受酷刑和强奸的迹象。

;

;“我们看到了手臂和脚被砍掉的肢解尸体，被砍头的人，被砍头的儿童，”一份保留令只知道她名字的警官阿维加伊尔告诉记者。

;

;她说，对存放在冷藏集装箱中的尸体进行法医检查，发现了多起强奸案。

;

;”我们用我们拥有的一切手段进行身份识别，”一位名叫马扬上尉的军医说。 “我们看到他们处于严重的虐待阶段。我们看到枪声，我们看到纯粹是酷刑的迹象。”

;

;监督身份识别过程的军事人员没有提供任何图片或形式的法医证据。医疗记录。

;

;控制加沙地带的伊斯兰运动哈马斯否认虐待指控。

;

;数百名哈马斯枪手，其中一些骑摩托车，冲破了加沙周围的障碍。 10 月 7 日凌晨，袭击了附近的社区，袭击了一个大型户外舞会以及住宅和军事基地，并绑架了 120 多名以色列人和外国人。一天之内死亡人数空前，还有被占领的城镇和基布兹出现的可怕画面。

;

;作为回应，以色列喷气式飞机和大炮连续几天轰炸加沙地带，在预期的地面入侵之前，杀害了 2,200 多名巴勒斯坦人，摧毁了数千座建筑物。

;

;以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡将哈马斯与伊斯兰国相比较，伊斯兰国因在叙利亚等国公开斩首而闻名于世。和伊拉克。

;;周六（10 月 14 日）数百名哀悼者参加了路透社视频记者伊萨姆·阿卜杜拉 (Issam Abdallah) 的葬礼，他在黎巴嫩南部的一次导弹袭击中丧生。;
;

;黎巴嫩军队周六表示，以色列黎巴嫩南部发射了一枚导弹，导致一名路透社记者身亡，黎巴嫩军方消息人士称，该国在袭击发生后进行了实地技术评估，支持其说法。

;

;黎巴嫩军方消息人士还表示称，根据事发时黎巴嫩军队巡逻队在该地区的观察，军方断定这枚炮弹是以色列发射的。该消息人士未获授权接受媒体采访，并以匿名方式接受路透社采访。

;

;“以色列敌人发射了一枚导弹，击中了一家媒体集团的一辆民用汽车，导致摄像师殉难。黎巴嫩陆军高级指挥部在其网站上发布的一份声明中表示：“伊萨姆·阿卜杜拉”。

;

;路透社在一份声明中表示：“我们呼吁以色列国防军（IDF）迅速、彻底地采取行动，和透明的调查。对于记者来说，能够自由、安全地进行报道至关重要。”

;

;路透社视频记者阿卜杜拉 (Abdallah) 在靠近 Alma al-Shaab 村的其他记者工作时被杀。以色列边境，以色列军队和黎巴嫩民兵真主党一直在交火。

;

;以色列军方没有立即回应黎巴嫩的说法，也没有回应对路透社签署的声明发表评论的请求由总统保罗·巴斯科伯特和主编亚历山德拉·加洛尼撰写。

;

;以色列陆军发言人理查德·赫克特中校早些时候在例行简报中表示正在调查这一事件，并补充道：“我们已经有了视觉效果。我们正在进行盘问。这是一件悲惨的事情。”

;

;现场的路透社目击者称，黎巴嫩国民阿卜杜拉被从以色列方向发射的导弹击中。

;

;官方媒体早些时候报道说，黎巴嫩将向联合国安理会就“以色列蓄意杀害”阿卜杜拉提出正式申诉。

;

;外交部长阿卜杜拉·布·哈比卜后来证实，申诉称以色列“直接轰炸”了记者，但没有详细说明。 ，导致伊萨姆·阿卜杜拉死亡。

;

;虽然包括美联社和半岛电视台在内的其他新闻媒体称这些炮弹是以色列制造的，但路透社并未证实这些导弹是由以色列发射的，也没有证实以色列发射的导弹是以色列制造的。故意针对记者。

;

;各国定期写信给由 15 个成员国组成的安理会提出投诉，该机构不太可能采取任何行动。

;

;阿卜杜拉于周六下葬。他的遗体覆盖着黎巴嫩国旗，由数百名哀悼者参加，游行队伍穿过他位于黎巴嫩南部的家乡希亚姆。记者们将相机放在坟墓上以纪念他，并为他祈祷。

;

;“他们坐在没有炮击的地方，什么也没有。他们从远处拍摄炮击。为什么要轰炸他们？”阿卜杜拉的母亲法蒂玛·坎索在葬礼上说道，她将儿子的死归咎于以色列。

;

;阿卜杜拉与另外两名路透社记者 Maher Nazeh 和 Thaer Al-Sudani 以及半岛电视台媒体集团的记者在一起和法新社，他在为广播公司提供现场视频信号时被杀。

;

;纳泽和苏丹尼均在事件中受伤，但后来出院。法新社和半岛电视台均表示，他们的两名记者在事件中受伤。

;

;纳泽称，他们正在拍摄从以色列方向发射的导弹，一枚导弹击中了坐在低处的阿卜杜拉。靠近小组其他成员的石墙。他说，几秒钟后，另一枚导弹击中了该组织正在使用的一辆汽车，导致其起火。

;

;驻黎巴嫩南部的联合国维和部队联黎部队表示，现阶段无法确定该组织是如何一群记者被击中。然而，它表示知道以色列于下午 5 点 20 分（格林威治标准时间 1320）袭击了阿尔玛沙卜外 2.5 公里（1.5 英里）的阵地。

;

;路透社声明称，它已要求以色列保证路透社记者和加沙地带的办事处不会成为以色列军事行动的目标。

;

;以色列军队正在与南部飞地接壤的边境集结坦克和部队，为可能的地面入侵做准备。他们正在与加沙的哈马斯武装分子交战，哈马斯武装分子一周前对以色列平民和士兵发动了致命袭击。

;;路透社记者 Issam Abdallah 在扎波罗热接受路透社采访时拍摄了乌克兰妇女 Zhanna Lishchynska（未上图） ，乌克兰，2022 年 4 月 17 日。路透社/Ueslei Marcelino/档案照片;
;

;路透社视觉记者伊萨姆·阿卜杜拉 (Issam Abdallah)，37 岁，于周五在以色列-黎巴嫩边境拍摄以色列导弹袭击时丧生，他为过去十年中一些重大新闻报道的工作带来了勇气、同情心和洞察力。

;

;无论是报道叙利亚和伊拉克针对伊斯兰国的战争、俄罗斯入侵乌克兰，还是报道星期五，阿卜杜拉去世后，他的同事们回忆道，阿卜杜拉在家乡黎巴嫩街头发生枪战，他擅长讲述人们经历灾难的故事。

;

;“多年来报道冲突和战争，我学到了很多东西。”与来自该地区各地的路透社一起，这幅画不仅是前线和烟雾，还有触动我们所有人内心的不为人知的人类故事，”去年在乌克兰执行一项艰巨的任务后，他写信给编辑。

;

;阿卜杜拉因对贝鲁特港口爆炸的出色报道而被提名为 2020 年路透社年度视频记者，为世界提供了一些有关这场灾难的第一批也是最震撼的图像。他是一个更大团队的一员，该团队于 2022 年因对乌克兰的报道而获奖。

;

;“他热衷于讲述他所看到的发生在他眼前的故事。这种热情与路透社欧洲视频编辑埃莉诺·拜尔斯 (Eleanor Biles) 表示：“教皇来访或报道地震。”

;

;在世界上一些最危险的地方进行报道时，阿卜杜拉在同行中享有在困难环境中小心谨慎的声誉。他努力确保自己和同事的安全。

;

;在 2019 年长达数周的艰苦任务中，阿卜杜拉是第一批报道数百名伊斯兰国武装分子投降消息的记者之一”他们在叙利亚东部的最后一个据点。

;

;“他的报道勇敢而负责任，”华盛顿邮报记者埃伦·弗朗西斯说，她曾在路透社工作并与他一起部署在那里。

;

;当他的祖国黎巴嫩陷入经济崩溃和无休无止的政治危机时，阿卜杜拉常常为路透社贝鲁特分社的气氛欢呼，与同事及其家人建立密切的友谊。

;

;他喜欢带同事来据该通讯社贝鲁特分社的记者称，阿卜杜拉经常一起为整个办公室订购丰盛的早餐，并经常拿出相机拍合影。

;

;阿卜杜拉于周六在他的家乡希亚姆下葬。在黎巴嫩南部，他的父亲去年去世了。他身后留下了母亲、两个兄弟和一个妹妹。

;

;黎巴嫩军队表示，以色列发射的导弹杀死了阿卜杜拉，现场的另一名路透社记者表示，他是被从方向发射的射弹杀死的。以色列。以色列军方表示将展开调查。路透社呼吁其进行“彻底、迅速和透明”的调查，并;说，记者能够自由、安全地进行报道“至关重要;”。

;

;阿卜杜拉的尸体被黎巴嫩国旗覆盖，由数百名哀悼者参加的游行队伍抬着. 记者们将相机放在坟墓上以纪念他，并进行了祈祷。

;

;阿卜杜拉大约 16 年前开始向路透社提供镜头，当时他在完成大学学业的同时担任自由职业者。“他的热情是ITN 新闻的外交新闻编辑卢特菲·阿布·安 (Lutfi Abu Aun) 表示：“他的专业精神毫无疑问具有感染力，他的人性在最黑暗的地方是一盏明灯。”卢特菲·阿布·安 (Lutfi Abu Aun) 是路透社的高级制片人，他聘请了阿卜杜拉。

;

;这种热情任何见过他的人都清楚。阿卜杜拉无论走到哪里都带着摄像机和静态照片相机，骑着摩托车在贝鲁特周围飞驰。

;

;他很乐意拍摄有关日常生活中离奇的一面的故事。当他报道现代战争的恐怖时。他的专题故事通常是关于黎巴嫩的夏季音乐节和动物，暗示着他深受同事喜爱的俏皮幽默。

;

;他提供的第一个镜头是 2007 年贝鲁特的冲突，他报道了之间的重大战斗次年，黎巴嫩人来到首都。

;

;对于路透社中东和北非首席视觉制作人拉比卜·纳西尔 (Labib Nasir) 来说，阿卜杜拉在报道 2020 年贝鲁特港口爆炸后的混乱时刻时表现得最为出色，这场爆炸摧毁了大部分地区。爆炸发生几分钟后，阿卜杜拉就骑着摩托车穿过布满灰尘的街道到达灾难现场，提供现场视频片段，只是停下来采访沿途的一名受伤男子

;

;到达港口后，他向世界展示了这座城市被毁的粮仓的第一眼景象，纳西尔说，“这个背景已经成为这个故事的视角”。

;

;他后来的工作记录了黎巴嫩妇女 Liliane Cheaito 的故事，她在爆炸中瘫痪并无法说话，影响很大，她的家人能够筹到足够的钱带她去土耳其接受治疗。

;

;她的家人要求不要带着大相机进入她的病房拍摄这个故事，他只带着手机进去，自我介绍并请求她允许拍摄，直到她用眼神表示“是”

;

;“伊萨姆对工作的坚定奉献和对图像力量的信念将永远铭刻在我们的记忆中，”路透社全球外交政策编辑萨米亚·纳库尔 (Samia Nakhoul) 说道。

;

;“这是通过他自己的现场摄像头显示，全世界目睹了导致他悲惨死亡的致命炮弹。”

;周六，俄罗斯军队对乌克兰东部城镇阿夫季夫卡发动猛烈攻击，炮击如此猛烈，以至于紧急救援人员该镇的高级行政官员表示，我们无法从被毁建筑物中救出死者。

;

;这是乌克兰工业中心顿巴斯的小镇连续第五天遭受袭击，该镇是莫斯科 19 个月的军事行动的焦点。俄罗斯和美国都将阿夫迪夫卡周围暴力事件的激增描述为俄罗斯的新一轮进攻。

;

;1000公里范围内其他地区的战斗也愈演愈烈。 - 长（600英里）的前线。乌克兰一名高级指挥官表示，更北部的冲突“显着恶化”，而另一名指挥官则表示，俄罗斯在战争南部地区的损失正在增加。

;

;阿夫季夫卡军事管理局局长维塔利·巴拉巴什表示，居民经历了罕见的一夜之间的情况空袭稍作喘息，但黎明时袭击又重新开始。

;

;

;

;周六，美洲各地的数千人凝视天空，目睹了一种被称为日环食的罕见现象，当月亮经过太阳前面时，天空中会瞬间出现“火环”。

;

;“这是你不能错过的事情之一，”26 岁的奥斯卡·洛佩兹 (Oscar Lopez) 说道，他从墨西哥城前往墨西哥南部城市坎佩切观看日食。 “太神奇了。作为人类，我们真的很幸运能够体验这些事情。”

;

;美国航天局 NASA 表示 ;日食;沿着美国太平洋西北地区出发，经过加利福尼亚州、内华达州、犹他州、亚利桑那州、新墨西哥州和德克萨斯州，穿越墨西哥部分地区，危地马拉、伯利兹、洪都拉斯、尼加拉瓜、巴拿马、哥伦比亚和巴西，最后在大西洋日落时结束。

;

;洛佩兹和他的家人是数百名戴着墨镜的观众之一，聚集在一起观看月亮慢慢地滑过大西洋。坎佩切 (Campeche) 是一座风景如画的殖民时代城市，位于尤卡坦半岛 (Yucatan Peninsula) 的西缘，清晨太阳的面容。

;

;当月球经过地球和太阳之间时，就会发生环形日食。位于或接近距我们星球的最远点。与日全食不同，它不会完全遮挡太阳的表面。

;

;相反，它在太阳的轮廓上创建了一个明亮的环的图像，围绕着月亮的黑色圆盘。

;

; p>;

;26 岁的墨西哥视频编辑艾萨克·索利斯 (Isaac Solis) 在坎佩切抬头仰望太阳时，选择了日食向他 27 岁的女友阿隆德拉·德·耶稣·阿吉拉尔 (Alondra de Jesus Aguilar) 求婚。

;

; “我根本没想到会这样，”阿吉拉尔说。 “我感觉真的很幸福。而且真的很确定我想和他共度一生。”

; Sun, 15 Oct 2023 03:25:02 +0800 Israel prepares ground assault on Gaza as Palestinians fleehttps://reuters.com/article/israel-palestinians/israel-prepares-ground-assault-on-gaza-as-palestinians-flee-idUSKBN31D28T

;;
;;Israeli infantry made their first raids into the Gaza Strip on Friday since Hamas fighters rampaged through southern Israel, and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said a campaign of retaliation had only just begun. Almond Li reports.;
;

;Israel was preparing on Saturday to launch a ground assault in the Hamas-controlled Gaza Strip, after telling Palestinians living in the densely populated territory to flee south towards a closed border with Egypt.

;

;The Israeli national security adviser meanwhile warned Lebanese militant group Hezbollah not to start a war on a second front to Israel's north, threatening the "destruction of Lebanon" it if did.

;

;Israel has vowed to annihilate the Hamas militant group that controls Gaza in retaliation for a rampage by its ;fighters;, who stormed through Israeli towns a week ago, gunning down civilians and making off with scores of hostages in the worst attack on civilians in Israel's history.

;

;Some 1,300 people were killed in a brutal onslaught that left Israel in profound shock, both at the scale of the killing and at horrifying mobile phone footage and reports from medical and emergency services of atrocities in the towns and kibbutzes that were overrun.

;

;In response, Israeli jets and artillery have subjected Gaza to the most intense bombardment it has ever seen, putting the enclave, home to 2.3 million Palestinians, under total siege.

;

;Gaza authorities say more than 2,200 people have been killed, a quarter of them children, and nearly 10,000 wounded. Rescue workers searched desperately for survivors of nighttime air raids.

;

;Thousands of Palestinians fled the north of the Gaza Strip on Saturday from the path of the expected Israeli ground assault, while Israel pounded the area with more air strikes and said it kept two roads open to let people escape.

;

;Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh said Palestinians would "remain in our land" even as one million Gaza residents were reported to have fled their homes since Israel began its bombardment.

;

;The surprise Hamas attack on Oct. 7 has launched the region into a new crisis as furious Israeli leaders prepare to respond with crushing force.

;

;"IDF (Israel Defense Forces) soldiers and battalions are deployed across the country and are increasing operational readiness for the next stages of the war, with an emphasis on significant ground operations," the military said in a statement.

;

;It added this would include air, sea and land assaults and cover an "expanded arena of combat", without elaborating.

;

;On Friday, the Israeli military told the population of the northern half of the Gaza Strip, which includes the enclave's biggest settlement Gaza City, to move south immediately.周六，它表示将保证在下午 4:00（格林威治标准时间 1300）之前逃离两条主要道路的巴勒斯坦人的安全。 As the deadline passed, troops were massing around Gaza.

;

;Hamas has told people not to leave and says roads out are unsafe.据称，周五载有难民的汽车和卡车遭到袭击，造成数十人死亡，但路透社无法独立核实这一消息。 Israel says Hamas is preventing people from leaving to use them as human shields, which Hamas denies.

;

;In Gaza City's Tel Al-Hawa neighbourhood, in the area Israel ordered evacuated, warplanes bombed a residential area during the night hitting several houses, according to residents who took refuge at the nearby Al Quds hospital.

;

;"We lived a night of horror. Israel punished us for not wanting to leave our home. Is there brutality worse than this?", a father of three said by telephone from the hospital, declining to give his name for fear of reprisals.

;

;"I prefer to die and not leave, but I can't see my wife and children die before my eyes."

;

;The Palestinian Red Crescent said it had received an Israeli order to evacuate the hospital by 4:00 pm, but would not do so because it had a humanitarian duty to keep providing services to the sick and wounded.

;

;In Khan Younis, in the southern Gaza Strip, where Israeli planes struck a four-storey building overnight, neighbours rushed to rescue people.

;

;A Gaza journalist filmed an ambulance crew searching for survivors of a nighttime air strike.可以看到一名护理人员走进一条被头灯照亮的小巷，这时另一次袭击发出的巨大闪光在他面前爆发。当飞机在上空呼啸而过时，医务人员冲进救护车并迅速离开。 One injured medic screamed: "My eyes! My eyes!"

;

;The attacks on Israel have plunged the nation into deep grief and galvanised it for war, with hundreds of thousands of reservists mobilised within days.

;

;Families of the kidnapped Israelis are terrified for their safety. Avichai Brodetz, a farmer from Kibbutz Kfar Aza whose wife and three children were taken captive to Gaza, set up a camp outside the Israeli army headquarters to focus attention on their plight.

;

;"The first thing that needs to happen is the release of the women and children," he told reporters.

;

;Hamas's armed wing said nine captives including four foreigners had been killed overnight due to Israeli air strikes. It has previously threatened to kill one hostage for every building Israel strikes without warning.

;

;Israel's attacks on Gaza failed to halt Hamas missile strikes deep into Israeli cities. Air raid sirens wailed in central Israel on Saturday and rockets smashed into a greenhouse in Ashkelon and wounded four people at a kibbutz.

;

;The only route out of Gaza not under Israeli control is a checkpoint with Egypt at Rafah.埃及官方表示其一侧是开放的，但由于以色列的袭击，交通已中断数天。 Egyptian security sources said the Egyptian side is being reinforced and Cairo has no intention of accepting a mass influx of refugees.

;

;A US State Department official said the United States was working to open the crossing on Saturday to let some people out, and had been in touch with Palestinian-Americans who want to leave Gaza. Washington later ;said; it had told its citizens to try to reach the crossing.

;

;Countries and aid agencies have sent supplies to Egypt but have so far been unable to bring them into Gaza. Israel says nothing can enter through Rafah without its coordination.

;

;Israel says its evacuation order is a humanitarian gesture to protect residents while it roots out Hamas fighters. The United Nations says so many people cannot be safely moved inside the besieged enclave without causing a humanitarian disaster.

;

;Hamas has vowed to fight until the last drop of blood, and says the order to leave the north of the enclave is a trick to force residents to give up their homes.

;

;The violence in Gaza has been accompanied by the deadliest clashes at Israel's northern border with Lebanon since 2006, raising fears of war spreading to another front.

;

;Lebanon's armed Hezbollah movement, a close ally of Iran like Hamas, said it had fired at five Israeli outposts in the disputed Shebaa Farms area with guided missiles and mortar bombs.

;

;Reuters saw missiles fired at an Israeli army post and heard shelling from Israel and gunfire.

;

;Israel's Kan radio reported five border villages had been put under lockdown in response to a suspected incursion from Lebanon.

;

;Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's security adviser Tzachi Hanegbi said Israel was "trying not to be drawn into a two-front war" and warned Hezbollah to stay out of the fighting.

;

;"We hope Hezbollah won't, de facto, bring about the destruction of Lebanon, because if there is a war there the result will be no less," he said, alluding to long-standing Israeli threats to launch heavy strikes on the country in a bid to stem launches of Hezbollah's extensive missile arsenal.

;

;Washington is also determined to ensure Iran and Iran-backed groups such as Lebanon's Hezbollah do not enter the conflict.

; Sun, 15 Oct 2023 02:55:03 +0800 Palestinians haunted by “Nakba“ while bracing for Gaza offensivehttps://reuters.com/article/israel-palestinians-nakba/palestinians-haunted-by-nakba-while-bracing-for-gaza-offensive-idUSKBN31E0DD
;;2023-10-14T17:58:23Z;
;;
;;Palestinians, who fled their houses amid Israeli strikes, shelter at a United Nations-run school, after Israel's call for more than 1 million civilians in northern Gaza to move south, in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip October 14, 2023. REUTERS/Ahmed Zakot;
;

;When Israel told residents of Gaza to leave their homes in the densely populated Palestinian enclave ahead of an expected ground offensive, Fawziya Shaheen, 90, recalled a dark chapter that is seared into the consciousness of Palestinians.

;

;The idea of leaving or being driven out of land on which they want to forge a state carries echoes of the "Nakba", or "catastrophe", when many Palestinians ;fled or were forced from their homes; during the 1948 war that accompanied Israel's creation.

;

;"Whatever happens we will not be displaced. They are striking us but we are not going to leave our homes and we will not be displaced," said Shaheen, sitting at home with her grandchildren facing relentless Israeli bombardment and shortages of bread, drinking water and power outages.

;

;Israel had given the population of the northern half of the Gaza Strip until Saturday morning to move south. It later said it would guarantee the safety of Palestinians fleeing on two main roads until 4:00 pm (1300 GMT). As the deadline passed, ;troops were massing; around the Gaza Strip.

;

;"I remembered the time when we were displaced the first time and what is happening to us now. It is all the fault of America and the countries who made normalization with the Jews (Israel)," said Shaheen, who lives in an alley inside the Khan Younis refugee camp.

;

;"Even if America, Israel or any other state intervenes we will stay put and we will not leave our homes."

;

;Shaheen was originally displaced from Al-Majdal and ended up in impoverished Gaza, now one of the most densely populated places in the world. She witnessed the 1948, 1956, 1967, 1973 wars and the conflicts between Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas.

;

;Some 700,000 Palestinians, half the Arab population of what was British-ruled Palestine, were dispossessed and displaced, many spilling into neighbouring Arab states where they or many of their descendants remain. Many still live in refugee camps.

;

;Israel contests the assertion that it drove Palestinians out, saying it was attacked by five Arab states after its creation.

;

;Israel has launched an ;intense bombardment;, vowing to annihilate the Hamas militant group that controls Gaza in retaliation for a rampage by its fighters who ;stormed through Israeli towns; a week ago, gunning down civilians and making off with scores of hostages. Some 1,300 people were killed in the worst attack on civilians in Israel's history.

;

;Israel says the evacuation order is a humanitarian gesture to protect residents from harm while it roots out Hamas fighters. The United Nations says so many people cannot be safely moved inside the besieged enclave without causing a humanitarian disaster.

;

;Hundreds of thousands of Gaza's 2.3 million residents have fled their homes, while remaining inside Gaza, a small slither of land wedged between Israel, Egypt and the Mediterranean Sea.

;

;The fate of Palestinian refugees is one of the thorniest issues in the moribund Israeli-Palestinian peace process. Palestinians and Arab states say a deal should include the right of those refugees and their descendants to return, something Israel rejects.

;

;Shehada Abu Draz, 80, is suspicious of an American-Israeli conspiracy to eject Palestinians to Egypt, even though that country has not indicated it will open its doors to any fleeing residents of Gaza.

;

;"We tell America, Israel and those who stand with it that we will never leave the Gaza Strip. We will die here," he said.

;

;"Israel occupied our land in 1948 and until now, and we will engage in a battle against Israel forever."

;

;"Every people under occupation must resist the occupation regardless of what is the price," he said.

; Sun, 15 Oct 2023 02:25:03 +0800 France deploys 7,000 troops for extra security after teacher slainhttps://reuters.com/article/france-security/france-deploys-7000-troops-for-extra-security-after-teacher-slain-idUSKBN31E02O
;;2023-10-14T18:19:18Z;
;

;French President Emmanuel Macron on Saturday deployed up to 7,000 soldiers for increased security patrols, as bomb alerts forced the evacuation of the Louvre museum a day after a teacher was killed in an Islamist attack.

;

;France was put on its highest security alert on Friday after a 20-year-old man ;fatally stabbed; a teacher and gravely wounded two other people at a school in the city of Arras in northern France.

;

;The Louvre museum, the Palace of Versailles and Paris' Gare de Lyon train station were evacuated on Saturday after receiving bomb alerts, which proved to be false alarms, Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin said.

;

;He declined to comment on the investigation into the Arras attack but said a "jihadist atmosphere" had developed following events in the Middle East, where Israel is conducting a military offensive against Hamas fighters after their deadly rampage last Saturday.

;

;"We think the absolutely disgusting geopolitics has allowed a certain number of people to take action in the name of radical Islam," Darmanin told a news conference.

;

;Macron's office said the soldiers would be deployed by Monday evening until further notice as part of an ongoing security operation in major city centres and tourist sites.

;

;The latest security alert comes as France hosts the Rugby World Cup and less than a year before Paris welcomes the Olympic Games, which include plans for an unprecedented opening ceremony outside a stadium and a parade down the river Seine.

;

;Darmanin told a news conference that 3,500 police officers would be deployed on Saturday and Sunday to provide security for the matches as well as to protect Jewish sites.

;

;France has been targeted by a series of Islamist attacks over the years, the worst being a simultaneous assault by gunmen and suicide bombers on entertainment venues and cafes in Paris in November 2015.

;

;Darmanin said 189 anti-Semitic acts had been identified since last Saturday and 65 arrests made, adding that several pro-Hamas associations would be dissolved.

;

;France has banned pro-Palestinian protests and nine people were arrested at small demonstration in Paris on Saturday in defiance of the ban.
